titleStmt.author: Gore, John

analytic.title: To the Right VVorshipfull Sr IOHN MEDE KNIGHT, High-Sheriffe for the County of ESSEX; My bountifull and uncorrupted Patron.
analytic.author: Gore, John

monogr.title: Certaine sermons preached upon severall occasions : viz. The vvay to prosper. The vvay to be content. The vvay to vvell-doing. A summer sermon. A vvinter sermon. Vnknowne kindnesse. The poore mans hope. By Iohn Gore Rector of Wenden-lofts in Essex
monogr.author: Gore, John, Rector of Wendenlofts, Essex

div.head: To the Right VVorshipfull Sr IOHN MEDE KNIGHT, High-Sheriffe for the County of ESSEX; My bountifull and uncorrupted Patron.
div.p:
MY Talent is little, but my love is great; were J able to expresse it in a greater measure, or in an higher nature, you should be sure to finde it; but J must say with that Father, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , &c. All that poore Ministers have to requite their friends withall is Bookes and Prayers; Accept
therefore I beseech you, this weake Sermon (not worth the name of a Booke) as a pledge of my humble thankefulnesse: and for my prayers to God on the behalfe of your selfe, your good Lady, and your loving Children and Family, they shall be never wanting from

closer.signed: Your poore devoted Chaplain, IOHN GORE.
